meanings.definition: Lead or guide together with others.
meanings.sent1: We will be coleading the hiking group to the mountain top.
meanings.sent2: The teachers are coleading the students on the field trip.
meanings.sent3: The siblings decided to colead the family game night for a change.
meanings.sent4: The captain and the first mate colead the ship through the stormy seas.
meanings.sent5: The coach and the captain coleading the team to victory was a sight to behold.

meanings.definition: The act of leading or guiding together with others.
meanings.sent1: Their coleading of the project resulted in great success.
meanings.sent2: The coleading of the expedition was a collaborative effort.
meanings.sent3: The coleading of the dance performance was a delightful spectacle.
meanings.sent4: The coleading of the orchestra was like a harmonious symphony.
meanings.sent5: The coleading of the group discussion made the meeting more productive.
